--- RAMI EFAL <rami_efal@...> wrote:

> 
> Hi again! does anyone know of what would consist a
> ceremony of anointment of a daimyo in beginning of
> Edo period (mid 17th Centaury)?

I don't believe there was one. Perhaps the bakufu
would send a message to the heir of the daimyo who
died, confirming that he would retain the possessions
of his father, but there was no "coronation" or
anything. Dad died, son took over. 

> (on the same note, some spell DAIMYO and some
> DAIMYU. which is correct the correct spelling?)

Daimyo.
